Frame.Nav: Tapered track guards reduce buildup of job site material, making clean-up easier.
Hoses for auxiliary hydraulics are routed to a shut-off valve on the arm for easy connect and disconnect of attachments and less hydraulic fluid spill.
Guard protects cylinder from being damaged and extends component life.
Control pattern change kit allows operator to switch easily between single- and bi-directional hydraulic valves.
A cab is optional for use in adverse weather conditions. The cab features wide glass panels that provide excellent visibility and extra door width for easy entry.
Speed control button on travel control handles allows operator to use his feet to track the machine using foot pedals.
The backfill blade on CXB Series excavators can be raised up to a 35-degree angle for improved trailer loading.
A three post ROPS permits a 40 percent increase in the entrance opening to the operator work platform while also increasing visibility.
Wider, level work platform for operator comfort and easy cleaning.
Low-effort joystick controls for reduced operator fatigue.

Case B Series Compact Excavators feature a zero tail swing design, whereby the counterweight never extends beyond the tracks. This feature greatly reduces the risk of collisions with surrounding structures, and permits use of the machine in extremely confined spaces.

The versatile center swing boom can be positioned anywhere within a 130 degree arc. Therefore, an operator can use the machine as a standard excavator, or swing the boom on an angle to accommodate any challenging application. The swing boom makes B Series Compact Excavators ideal for working in tight spaces, whether a cramped downtown construction site or along a highway.
A redesigned backfill blade boils material in front of the blade for more efficient backfilling.
Hoses routed through swing tower and top of boom improves line of sight for the operator while offering additional hose protection from job site debris.
Two-speed hydrostatic control for smooth ease of operation.
Ground-level access to fuel fill. Fuel tank cap is lockable.
Top roller guide reduces track wear.

Bucket sizes can be matched to CXB Series Compact Excavators with standard widths ranging from 12-36 inches (305-914 mm) and associated heaped capacities from 3.0-9.8 ft.³ (0.085-0.277 m³). CXB Excavators can be matched with a variety of attachments including hammers, compaction wheels and thumbs.
Easy access to engine ensures that daily maintenance will be completed.
Grease-type hydraulic track adjusters make it easy to maintain track tension.
Steel tracks are optional.

Nav.SubTitle: Access panel to valving and coolers

Frame.Nav: Case continues to implement improvements that simplify the maintenance and servicing of all its product lines. On CXB Series Compact Excavators, access to hydraulic valves and coolers is easily gained through a one-piece, swing-out side access panel.
